intro: Amblynotus chinganicus, commonly known as the Chinese amblynotus, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
